ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: metric used for finding co-expressed genes (gene neighbors)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of Pearson measure, which considers the relative differences (e.g. A*B/|A|.|B|) assuming that the scale is uniform (that the distance from zero is relative). In some cases this can give better results, particularly where the data is not 'normally' distributed.

Concepts.definition: A type of pearson measure, which considers the relative differences (e.g. A*B/Abs[A]*Abs[B]) assuming that the scale is uniform (that the distance from zero is relative). In some cases this can give better results, particularly where the data is not 'normally' distributed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A generalization of the Pythagorean theorem to more than two coordinates. It is what would be obtained if the distance between two points were measured with a ruler: the "intuitive" idea of distance.

Concepts.definition: A generalization of the Pythagorean theorem to more than two coordinates. It is what would be obtained if the distance between two points were measured with a ruler: the "intuitive" idea of distance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sum of the absolute differences between two variables (e.g. |A-B|). Unlike the euclidean distance this does not give an overemphasis to greater distances. This should generally be considered the default distance measure to be used in most operations.

Concepts.definition: The sum of the absolute differences between two variables (e.g. Abs[A-B]). Unlike the euclidean distance this does not give an overemphasis to greater distances. This should generally be considered the default distance measure to be used in most operations.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of the correlation of two variables X and Y measured on the same object or organism, that is, a measure of the tendency of the variables to increase or decrease together. It is defined as the sum of the products of the standard scores of the two measures divided by the degrees of freedom.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the correlation of two variables X and Y measured on the same object or organism, that is, a measure of the tendency of the variables to increase or decrease together. It is defined as the sum of the products of the standard scores of the two measures divided by the degrees of freedom.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
